intro: Polyalthia ichthyosma, commonly known as the silver-leafed tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, silver-gray bark and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in tropical regions.
